definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: desire, take pleasure in (Aram. [[חֲמַד]] (not in Syr.); Ar. h.amida praise, eulogize, appove of; Sab. [[חמדס]] in gratitude [praise] there-for DHM:ZMG 1875, 595; 1876, 686)—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: in bad sense of inordinate, ungoverned, selfish desire, sq. acc. Ex 20:17, Ex 20:17 (E) = De 5:18 (v:De 5:18 b has [[תִּתְאַוֶּה]]), Ex 34:24 (JE) De 7:25, Jos 7:21 (JE) Mic 2:2, Pr 12:12; of lustful desire Pr 6:25.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: = take pleasure in, of idolatrous tendency Is 1:29, so pt. pl. [[חֲמוּדֵיהֵם]] Is 44:9 their delightful things (things in which they delight, v. also v:11and Bev:JPh. xvii. 1888. p. 126); [[לֵחִים]] [[לָחוֹן חָֽמְדוּ]] Pr 1:22 how long do scorners delight in scoring.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: less often in good sense, said of God [[לְשִׁבְתּוֹ]] ´[[הָהָר חָמַד א]], poet. Ps 68:17; obj. the suffering servant of ´[[י]], Is 53:2 no beauty in him, that we should desire him (choose him, be drawn toward him); pt. pass. coll. [[חֲמוּדוֹ]] Ps 39:12 his desired things, i. e. chosen, choice, desirable (v. Niph.); so prob. Job 20:20.

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pt. [[נֶחְמָד]] Ge 2:9 + 2 t.; [[הַנֶּחֱמָדִים]] Ps 19:11; —desirable: ´[[עץ נ]] [[לְמַרְאֶה]] Ge 2:9, [[לְהַשְׂכִּיל]] ´[[נ]] Ge 3:6, [[מִוׇהָב]] ´[[הַנֶּח]] Ps 19:11 which are more desirable than gold; [[אוֹחָר נֶחְמָד]] Pr 21:20 desirable, i.e. costly treasure.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. 1 s. delight greatly [[וְיׇשַׁ֫בְתִּי]] ´[[בְּחִלּוֹ ח]] Ct So 2:3 in his shadow I greatly delighted and sate, i.e. sate with great delight.
